meanings.definition: Refusal to compromise or change one's position
meanings.sent1: Her intransigences on the matter led to a stalemate in negotiations.
meanings.sent2: The intransigences of the two political parties made reaching a consensus impossible.
meanings.sent3: Despite his intransigences, he couldn't resist his favorite dessert.
meanings.sent4: The intransigences of the old oak tree stood firm against the storm.
meanings.sent5: The intransigences of the mountain were a barrier to the hikers' progress.

meanings.sent1: His intransigences in following the rules sometimes caused conflicts.
meanings.sent2: The teacher admired the student's intransigences in pursuing knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed intransigences in refusing to move from its sunny spot.
meanings.sent4: The intransigences of the old clock made it impossible to adjust the time.
meanings.sent5: Her intransigences in sticking to her routine were both admirable and frustrating.
